DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FERREIRA, A. M. D.;FERREIRA, A;Ferreira, A.M.D.C.;Costa Ferreira, Ana Maria D.;Ferreira, Ana M. D. C.;Ferreira, Ana Maria da Costa;Ferreira, Ana M.Da Costa;Ferreira, Ana Maria da C.;DA COSTA FERREIRA, ANA M.;FERREIRA, ANA;FERREIRA, ANA MARIA C.;DA COSTA FERREIRA, ANA MARIA;FERREIRA, A. M. D. C.;Ferreira, Ana M.;FERREIRA, ANA M.C.;FERREIRA, ANA M. DA COSTA;Da Costa Ferreira, A.M.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduou-se em Química pelo Instituto de Química da Universidade de São Paulo em 1971, onde também realizou doutorado em Química, sub-área Físico-Química, defendido em 1976, sob orientação do saudoso Pawel Krumholz e de José Manuel Riveros. Tem Pós-Doutorado realizado na Universidade Tor Vergata de Roma, Itália, em 1991/1992, na área de Química Biológica, no laboratório de Giuseppe Rotilio, e na State University of New York em Albany (SUNY at Albany), USA, no laboratório de Charles Scholes, em 1996/1997, focalizando Espectroscopia EPR. É professora titular da Universidade de São Paulo desde 2002. Tem experiência na área de Química Inorgânica, com ênfase em Química Inorgânica Biológica, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: síntese e caracterização espectroscópica de compostos de coordenação; atividade catalítica em reações de oxidação; processos redox; detecção e identificação de intermediários reativos; interações de íons metálicos e biomoléculas (especialmente proteínas e ácidos nucleicos); atividade biológica e farmacológica de complexos de metais de transição; desenvolvimento de novos metalofármacos com atividade antitumoral ou antiparasitária. Tem cerca de 120 publicações na área. Agraciada com a Comenda da Ordem Nacional do Mérito Científico, outorgada pelo Presidente da República e Ministro da Ciência e Tecnologia, em 2007 e a Medalha "Icaro S. Moreira? da Divisão de Química Inorgânica da Sociedade Brasileira de Química (SBQ) em 2009.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Graduate in Chemistry at University of São Paulo (1971) and Ph.D. in Chemistry from the same university (1976), under the supervision of the late Pawel Krumholz and José Manuel Riveros. Pos-Doc investigations at University Tor Vergata of Rome, Italy in 1991-1992, at Giuseppe Rotilio laboratory, and at State University of New York, Albany, USA, at Charles Scholes laboratory, in 1996/1997. Has experience in Biological Inorganic Chemistry, acting mainly on the following subjects: syntheses and spectroscopic characterization of metal complexes; catalytic activity of coordinated metal ions; redox processes; detection and identification of reactive intermediary species; interactions of metal ions with biomolecules (especially proteins and nucleic acids); biological and pharmacological reactivity of transition metal complexes; development of novel antitumor or antiparasite metallodrugs. Has 120 publications in the subject. Received the "Comenda da Ordem Nacional do Mérito Científico" from the Presidency of Brazil and Ministry of Science and Technology in 2007, and the Medal "Icaro S. Moreira? from the Inorganic Chemistry Division of the Brazilian Chemical Society (SBQ) in 2009.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Planejamento, caracterização e estudos de reatividade de novos catalisadores de oxidação, baseados em complexos de cobre, ferro, manganês,vanádio e outros metais, usando como oxidantes oxigênio molecular, peróxido de hidrogênio ou outros peróxidos. Verificação de intermediários de reação através de métodos químicos e espectroscópicos. Detecção e identificação dos principais produtos por métodos físico-químicos. Determinação de lei cinética e de prováveis mecanismos de reação. Desenvolvimento de novas aplicações com finalidade industrial e/ou ambiental.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES: Design, characterization and investigation of the reactivity of new oxidation catalysts, based in copper, iron, manganese, or vanadium complexes, using molecular oxygen, hydrogen peroxide or other peroxides as oxidants. Detection and identification of intermediary species and products of reaction through chemical, chromatographic and spectroscopic methods. Determination of kinetic law and kinetic parameters, as well as proposition of possible mechanisms of reaction. Development of new applications for industrial and environmental purposes.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: Preparação e estudos da estrutura e reatividade de complexos miméticos de metaloproteínas e metaloenzimas, especialmente de cobre, ferro ou manganês, visando a elucidação dos fatores preponderantes na determinação da atividade biológica. Caracterização dos complexos principalmente através de métodos espectroscópicos (UV/Vis, IR, EPR e CD). Estudos cinéticos e mecanismos de interação com oxidantes biológicos: oxigênio molecular, peróxido de hidrogênio e peroxinitrito. Detecção e identificação de intermediários reativos de reação. Estudos de atividade biológica, especialmente a verificação de potencial atividade antitumoral ou antiparasitária, através de interações com biomoléculas, membranas e organelas, com geração de espécies reativas ou inibição de proteínas e enzimas. Desenvolvimento de potenciais metalofármacos.
LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA-INGLES:
Preparation, and structural studies of mimetic compounds of metalloproteins and metalloenzymes, especially containing copper, iron or vanadium. Investigation of the reactivity of essential metals in biological medium, at the aim of elucidating the determinant factors of its biological activity. Structural and spectroscopic characterization of metal complexes (UV/Vis, IR, EPR and CD). 
Studies of oxidation processes, involving detection and identification of intermediary reactive species (ROS, RNS). Development of potential metallodrugs, particularly of antitumor and antiparasite compounds, verifying its interactions with crucial biomolecules (DNA, RNA, proteins and enzymes).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudos de Compostos Inorgânicos com Aplicação em Catálise, Farmacologia e Bioinorgânica - FAPESP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Neste projeto foram agrupadas investigações sobre a estrutura e a reatividade de espécies metálicas, envolvendo tanto metais essenciais, como ferro, cobre, manganês, vanádio ou cobalto, como espécies mais pesadas, como rutênio e ródio. As pesquisas, a serem realizadas por três grupos de pesquisa na área de Química Inorgânica, em três sub-projetos, abrangem: a) preparação e caracterização de espécies metálicas com ligantes diversos, incluindo bases de Schiff, bases nitrogenadas em geral, aminocarboidratos, carboxilatos, fármacos, porfirinas, ftalocianinas, etc.; b) estudos cinéticos e mecanísticos da atividade catalítica dessas espécies, frente a oxidantes usuais no meio biológico (oxigênio molecular, peróxido de hidrogênio e peroxinitrito), visando tanto elucidar melhor processos verificados in vivo, como mimetizar a especificidade e seletividade desses processos em catalisadores com possível aplicação em processos industriais; c) detecção e identificação de intermediários de reação, que apresentem interesse estrutural ou de reatividade; d) imobilização dessas espécies metálicas em estruturas inorgânicas lamelares visando, além da maior facilidade de separação do meio de reação e de reciclagem, a obtenção de catalisadores de oxidação com atividades e seletividades ímpares e, ainda, no caso de metalofármacos, potencializar a atividade farmacológica, em virtude da interação com as estruturas hospedeiras; e) inserção de complexos metálicos em estruturas poliméricas orgânicas, como maltodextrinas, visando aumentar sua solubilidade e sua estabilidade, facilitando assim sua aplicação farmacológica.
Colaborações envolvidas: Dra. Vera R.L. Constantino e Dra. Denise de Oliveira Silva.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Fapesp No. 05/60596-8- Espécies Complexas com Potencial Aplicação em Bioinorgânica, Catálise, Farmacologia e Química Ambiental: concepção, preparação, caracterização e reatividade (Coordenadora)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Neste projeto pretende-se dar continuidade e ampliar os estudos que vêem sendo desenvolvidos já há 4 anos, com apoio principalmente da FAPESP (Processo No. 01/09127-6). Investigações sobre a estrutura e a reatividade de espécies metálicas, envolvendo tanto metais essenciais, como ferro, cobre, zinco, manganês, vanádio ou cobalto, como espécies mais pesadas, como rutênio, livres em solução ou intercaladas em matrizes diversas, vêm sendo realizadas por três grupos de pesquisa na área de Química Inorgânica, abrangendo diferentes aspectos. Para este novo período as seguintes metas foram priorizadas:
1. Concepção e desenvolvimento de metodologia sintética para a preparação de espécies complexas de diferentes metais essenciais e não-essenciais com ligantes diversos, visando a obtenção de potenciais metalofármacos ou novos catalisadores;
2. Preparação e Utilização de espécies complexas de ferro e cobre, em solução ou inseridos em matrizes inorgânicas, como catalisadores da oxidação de poluentes e efluentes industriais por processos oxidativos avançados;
3. Obtenção de estruturas hospedeiras lamelares e de derivados na forma de ?nanoscrolls?, com a finalidade de preparar melhores catalisadores na área ambiental ou materiais híbridos orgânico-inorgânico com propriedades interessantes;
4. Imobilização e/ou encapsulamento de fármacos e metalofármacos, em hidróxidos duplos lamelares e em polímeros orgânicos naturais, visando potencializar a atividade farmacológica, diminuir efeitos colaterais e permitir uma liberação controlada no organismo;
5. Caracterização físico-química das novas espécies isoladas, utilizando desde técnicas mais convencionais, até as mais modernas, especialmente ESI-MS, XANES, EXAFS e TGA-DSC-MS; 
6. Avaliação da possível atividade biológica das espécies metaladas ou imobilizadas preparadas no laboratório, em diferentes processos de importância biológica.

Pesquisadores principais:
Ana Maria da Costa Ferreira (Coordenadora)
Vera Regina Leopoldo C
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
In this project, we intend to improve and expand studies under development in our laboratory, initiated 4 years ago (Processo FAPESP No. 01/09127-6). Investigations on the structure and reactivity of metal complexes, involving essential metal ions such as iron, copper, zinc, manganese, vanadium or cobalt, as well as heavy metal ions such as ruthenium, free in solution and also inserted in different matrices, have been carried out by 3 research groups, in the area of Inorganic Chemistry, with complementary interests. The main goals for this new period are:
1. Design and development of adequate methodologies for the preparation of several coordination compounds with essential and non-essential metal ions, and different ligands, with the aim of obtaining potential metallopharmaceuticals or new catalysts;
2. Preparation and Utilization of coordination compounds of iron and copper, in solution or inserted in inorganic frameworks, as catalysts for oxidation of pollutants, contaminants and industrial effluents by advanced oxidation processes;
3. Preparation of lamelar host structures and their ?nanoscroll? derivatives, with the aim of obtaining better catalysts for environmental purposes, or hybrid organic-inorganic materials with peculiar properties;
4. Immobilization and/or encapsulating of pharmaceuticals and metallopharmaceuticals, in double lamelar hydroxides, and in natural organic polymers, with the aim of improving their pharmacological activity, decreasing collateral effects, and allowing a controlled release in the organism;
5. Physicochemical characterization of the new prepared species, by using more conventional techniques as well as modern ones, specially ESI-MS, XANES, EXAFS and TGA-DSC-MS; 
6. Evaluation of possible biological activities of the free metallo- and/or immobilized-species prepared, in different processes of biological importance.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Coordination Compounds with Potential Application in Bioinorganic Chemistry, Catalysis, Pharmacology and Environmental Chemistry: design, preparation, characterization, and reactivity.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: INCT DE PROCESSOS REDOX EM BIOMEDICINA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Os projetos envolvidos neste INCT contemplam quatro objetivos principais focados no estudo de geração e controle de espécies reativas de oxigênio em sistemas biológicos; reatividade química de espécies reativas de oxigênio em ambientes biológicos e seus efeitos na estrutura e função de biomoléculas; mecanismos e redes envolvidos nos processos de sinalização celular ?redox? relevantes para doenças humanas e, por fim, aplicações diagnósticas e terapêuticas de ?processos redox?.
Ohara Augusto (coordenadora)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Avanços, Benefícios e Riscos da Nanobiotecnologia aplicada à Medicina e Saúde
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
O presente projeto integra uma equipe de pesquisadores e instituições brasileiras e
estrangeiras que desenvolvem trabalhos de pesquisa básica e aplicada, em áreas relacionadas à Nanobiotecnologia. Nosso principal objetivo é atuar na formação de Recursos Humanos em nível de graduação, pós-graduação e técnico, gerando pesquisadores e profissionais capazes de atuar na área de Nanobiotecnologia aplicada à Medicina e Saúde.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This project includes a network of researchers in different Brazilian and international institutions, working in the development of basic and applied studies on Nanobiotecnology. The main goal is to prepare a new generation at diverse levels (undergraduate and graduate students, as well as tecnicians), capable of acting in Nanobiotecnology applied to Medicine and Health.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Investigação de modificações oxidativas em proteínas catalisadas por íons metálicos e seus complexos com ligantes inspirados em biomoléculas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Processo: 490021/2008-5
PROGRAMA EXECUTIVO BRASIL/ITÁLIA - CNPq/MCT/MINISTÉRIO DAS RELAÇÕES EXTERIORES DA ITÁLIA1/2008-5
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Neste projeto pretende-se investigar a ocorrência de modificações oxidativas em proteínas, catalisadas por íons metálicos essenciais e seus respectivos complexos com ligantes inspirados em biomoléculas. Estudos anteriores da reatividade de derivados imínicos de oxindóis escolhidos, particularmente isatina, que mostraram ter atividade citotóxica frente a diferentes células tumorais, especialmente quando coordenados a metais como cobre ou zinco, indicaram sua potencial aplicação como agentes farmacológicos. Pretende-se planejar, sintetizar e monitorar a atividade catalítica desses complexos frente à oxidação de proteínas, como albuminas humana e bovina (HSA e BSA), visando elucidar melhor seus possíveis mecanismos de ação no meio biológico. Estes complexos são capazes de gerar espécies reativas de oxigênio (EROs), em presença de peróxido de hidrogênio ou de agentes redutores como glutationa ou ascorbato, com implicação em diversas doenças degenerativas, como diabetes mellitus, câncer, mal de Alzheimer ou Parkinson. Estes estudos também devem incluir a investigação de sua reatividade em presença -dicarbonílicos, como glioxal ou metilglioxal, conhecidos agentesde compostos de glioxidação de proteínas, através das chamadas reações de Maillard e conseqüentes rearranjos, com danos oxidativos significativos à proteína (formação de grupos carbonílicos, clivagens e formação de ligações cruzadas, por exemplo). Uma das principais ferramentas a ser usada é a cromatografia líquida acoplada a espectrometria de massa (LC/MS), para identificação dos sítios preferenciais de ataque oxidativo à proteína. Também serão investigados os mecanismos de atuação desses complexos metálicos frente a outras biomoléculas ou sistemas, como DNA e organelas, especialmente mitocôndrias, em continuidade a estudos anteriores, envolvendo ambos os grupos, brasileiro (coordenado por Ana Ferreira) e italiano (coordenado por Maria Ciriolo). Quer-se verificar como os íons de cobre (zinco ou magnésio)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Studies on protein oxidative modifications catalyzed by metal ions and metal complexes with biologically inspired ligands

FINANCIADOR-DO-PROJETO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Investigações de miméticos de oxidases de cobre: propriedades físico-químicas, estruturais, modelagem molecular e reatividade.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
COFECUB Project - USP, São Paulo/Universitè Paul Cèzanne- Marseille/Universitè Joseph Fourier - Grenoble
The chemistry of metalloproteins, metalloenzymes and related areas is a broad research field, demanding efforts of scientists with different expertise in varied research fields, in order to achieve significant results. Metal ions, such as iron or copper, usually perform crucial roles in biological processes, being responsible for primary functions. In addition to the noticeable biological interest, the study of metalloprotein mimics has impact on pharmacological and medical sciences, in catalysis, as well as in environmental sciences and in materials.
In this Project, studies on the chemistry of copper proteins, especially oxidases participating in the metabolism of oxygen (Ty, DbM, PAM?), and their corresponding mimics, based on amine and imine ligands, will be developed with the aim of better understand their structure-properties and structure-reactivity relationships. The proposed collaborations involve: a) design of biomimetic ligands, and respective metal complexes; b) syntheses of suitable mononuclear and dinuclear copper complexes; c) preparation of polynuclear species, with desirable magnetic interactions and/or catalytic activity; d) characterization by structural and spectroscopic properties studies; e) reactivity studies on oxidation of selected substrates (phenols, catechols, amines, etc); f) molecular modeling and electronic structure studies of the isolated ligand and/or of the corresponding metal complexes; g) application of QSPR and modeling approaches to study and to determine the relationships between the physical and chemical properties and one or more parameters (descriptors) related to the structures of the oxidase inhibitors; (f) studies and validation of physico-chemical and/or structural descriptors, that are relevant for the reactivity or for the biological activity, for sets of selected ligands and metal complexes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
The chemistry of metalloproteins, metalloenzymes and related areas is a broad research field, demanding efforts of scientists with different expertise in varied research fields, in order to achieve significant results. Metal ions, such as iron or copper, usually perform crucial roles in biological processes, being responsible for primary functions. In addition to the noticeable biological interest, the study of metalloprotein mimics has impact on pharmacological and medical sciences, in catalysis, as well as in environmental sciences and in materials.
In this Project, studies on the chemistry of copper proteins, especially oxidases participating in the metabolism of oxygen (Ty, DbM, PAM?), and their corresponding mimics, based on amine and imine ligands, will be developed with the aim of better understand their structure-properties and structure-reactivity relationships. The proposed collaborations involve: a) design of biomimetic ligands, and respective metal complexes; b) syntheses of suitable mononuclear and dinuclear copper complexes; c) preparation of polynuclear species, with desirable magnetic interactions and/or catalytic activity; d) characterization by structural and spectroscopic properties studies; e) reactivity studies on oxidation of selected substrates (phenols, catechols, amines, etc); f) molecular modeling and electronic structure studies of the isolated ligand and/or of the corresponding metal complexes; g) application of QSPR and modeling approaches to study and to determine the relationships between the physical and chemical properties and one or more parameters (descriptors) related to the structures of the oxidase inhibitors; (f) studies and validation of physico-chemical and/or structural descriptors, that are relevant for the reactivity or for the biological activity, for sets of selected ligands and metal complexes.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Investigations on copper-oxidases mimics: physicochemical and structural properties, molecular modeling and reactivity.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento e aplicação de métodos computacionais de alto desempenho
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Processo FAPESP 2004/08928-3 Desenvolvimento e aplicação de métodos computacionais de alto desempenho
Projeto Multiusuário - Uma rede de laboratórios usuários de métodos computacionais foi formada, envolvendo 66 grupos de pesquisa, sob a coordenação do prof. Luiz Nunes de Oliveira, para aquisição e instalação de um computador de alto desempenho (um dos 500 maiores do mundo). Atualmente esse computador MAMUTE - IBM (BladeCenter JS21 Cluster, PPC 970, 2.5 GHz, Myrinet) está instalado no LCCE da USP.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Processo FAPESP 2004/08928-3 Desenvolvimento e aplicação de métodos computacionais de alto desempenho
Uma rede de laboratórios usuários de métodos computacionais foi formada, sob a coordenação do prof. Luiz Carlos Nunes, para aquisição de um computador de alto desempenho (um dos 500 maiores do mundo). Atualmente o computador (MAMUTE)está localizado no LCCA da USP.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de Compostos com Interesse Farmacológico ou Medicinal e de Sistemas para seu Transporte, Detecção e Reconhecimento no Meio Biológico
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estudos sistemáticos sobre espécies reativas no meio biológico, implicadas em processos vitais ou patológicos serão realizados. Estas espécies serão planejadas, preparadas e isoladas como compostos livres ou inseridas em matrizes inorgânicas apropriadas, formando materiais funcionais, e terão sua reatividade investigada. Dentre estas espécies há diferentes substâncias, incluindo compostos orgânicos com propriedades antioxidantes ou oxidantes, polímeros, agentes quelantes e os respectivos complexos metálicos. Visa-se principalmente processos em que as espécies estudadas possam atuar como agentes farmacológicos ou medicinais. O projeto prevê ainda providenciar metodologia adequada para a detecção e monitoramento destas espécies, bem como para seu transporte, reconhecimento e estudos de sua toxicidade frente a alvos biológicos selecionados. A racionalização dos dados experimentais pretendidos será providenciada por cálculos teóricos, visando a previsão de espécies mais eficientes.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: CEPID - Redoxoma
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The Redox Processes in Biomedicine RIDC (Redoxome) is a multidisciplinary network of investigators focused on a concerted approach to investigating redox processes. These processes involve electron transfer reactions via free radicals
or non-radical intermediates, and have a unique potential to elucidate biochemical pathways underlying cell and organ (patho) physiology, as well as to disclose disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets. This enormous potential has not yet been fulfilled, mainly because of insuficiente basic mechanistic knowledge. The Redoxome Center will address issues relevant to overcoming such limitations to allow the design of effective antioxidant strategies and biomarkers of oxidative stress. Specifically, we will investigate: 1) reactive
oxygen species (ROS) generation and control in biological systems; 2) chemical reactivity of ROS in biological environments and consequent changes in the structure and function of biomolecules; 3) mechanisms and networks involved in redox signaling processes relevant to human disease; 4) diagnostic and therapeutic applications of redox processes. Such investigations comprise a coherent set of interconnected studies expected to bridge meaningful conceptual gaps in the field and to allow technological and educational advances. The pervasiveness of redox processes in the environment opens many possibilities for technological applications. Several public and private industrial sectors will benefit from new technologies developed by the Redoxome Center, varying from those in which Brazil has already acquired international leadership (personal care, fragrances, cosmetics, bioenergy) to those in which
industries are emerging but are still not competitive in the national and international markets (pharmaceutical, medical devices, diagnostics, ecological services). The main goal is to innovate in these industrial sectors. In addition, the aim is to implement a core laboratory (Redoxoma Analysis Platform ? RAP) at USP to provide state-of-the-art analytical tools for the evaluation of redox processes, which will be open for use by clinical and basic researchers. Redox
state markers should favor early detection of risk factors for a number of diseases, allowing the design of adequate interventions and maximizing the chances of correcting these conditions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Investigation on the role of metallodrug-carbohydrate interactions in multidrug resistance tumor cells
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In these proposed studies, we intend to prepare some copper(II), and analogous zinc(II) complexes, with imine and/or amine ligands, and characterize the isolated species by different techniques, especially by UV/Vis, IR, EPR, and NMR spectroscopies. Dr. Marius Réglier?s group, at Universitè de Marseille, will be mainly responsible for the design and syntheses of specific ligands, that will be used to prepare the corresponding copper(II) and zinc(II) complexes, including mono- and dinuclear species. The activity of this type of metal complexes towards melanoma cells, in particular some lines containing different expressions of galectin-3, will be verified with the collaboration of Prof. Roger CHammas (FM-USP).
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: In these proposed studies, we intend to prepare some copper(II), and analogous zinc(II) complexes, with imine and/or amine ligands, and characterize the isolated species by different techniques, especially by UV/Vis, IR, EPR, and NMR spectroscopies. Dr. Marius Réglier?s group, at Universitè de Marseille, will be mainly responsible for the design and syntheses of specific ligands, that will be used to prepare the corresponding copper(II) and zinc(II) complexes, including mono- and dinuclear species. The activity of this type of metal complexes towards melanoma cells, in particular some lines containing different expressions of galectin-3, will be verified with the collaboration of Prof. Roger Chammas (FM-USP).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimentos e Aplicações de Ferramentas Computacionais para Biologia: da Modelagem Molecular a Pesquisa Translacional
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Nosso laboratório realiza estudos de interações entre complexos metálicos com biomoléculas, visando elucidar suas atividades como potenciais agentes antitumorais ou antiparasitários. Simulações teóricas, em colaboração com componentes da rede, dão suporte a nossos dados experimentais e/ou nossos resultados comprovam previsões teóricas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The main goal in this project is to enable a collaboration network between USP (University of São Paulo) and UFPE (Federal University of Pernambuco) for a multidisciplinary interaction between physicists, chemists, biologists, pharmacists and computer scientists and the training of human resources in the Biological Computational field inside a scientific project that aims to apply computational tools to help solving biological problems.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Desenvolvimentos e Aplicações de Ferramentas Computacionais para Biologia: da Modelagem Molecular a Pesquisa Translacional

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SPRINT-FAPESP Advanced EPR spectroscopy applied to mechanistic studies on metallodrugsbiomolecules interactions
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Main goals:
a) Provide advanced experimental approaches to the proposed collaborative studies;
b) Elucidate probable mechanisms of action of metal complexes towards vital biological
targets;
c) Detect and identify reactive species (ROS, RNS, singlet oxygen) formed in metal
catalyzed processes;
d) Provide theoretical support for experimental data related to interactions of free ligands
and/or metal-complexes with biomolecules.
e) Build a framework for further collaborative work with colleagues at Manchester
University, allowing inter-institutional knowledge transfer and researcher training.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES:
Main goals:
a) Provide advanced experimental approaches to the proposed collaborative studies;
b) Elucidate probable mechanisms of action of metal complexes towards vital biological
targets;
c) Detect and identify reactive species (ROS, RNS, singlet oxygen) formed in metal
catalyzed processes;
d) Provide theoretical support for experimental data related to interactions of free ligands
and/or metal-complexes with biomolecules.
e) Build a framework for further collaborative work with colleagues at Manchester
University, allowing inter-institutional knowledge transfer and researcher training.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SPRINT-FAPESP Advanced EPR spectroscopy applied to mechanistic studies on metallodrugsbiomolecules interactions

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Atividade Catalítica de Íons Metálicos e Atuação de Antioxidantes em Reações de Oxidação - Proj. Temático FAPESP
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estudos da reatividade de complexos de ferro, cobre, cobalto e manganês com ligantes nitrogenados e oxigenados, frente ao oxigênio molecular e ao peróxido de hidrogênio foram realizados. As pesquisas envolveram síntese e caracterização dos complexos por técnicas espectroscópicas, monitoramento de reações, detecção de intermediários e proposição de prováveis mecanismos.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES:
Membro da Comissão de Pós-Graduação, como coordenadora da área de Química Inorgânica de 1993-1996. Reeleita para o período 1996-1999. Suplente em 1992.
 Responsável pela indicação de comissões e bancas examinadoras de mestrado e doutoramento, bem como de assessores para acompanhamento de relatórios semestrais e de bancas de exames de capacidade e de qualificação. 
 Responsável pela aplicação das verbas de projetos contemplados, no período, na área de Inorgânica (CNPq/PADCT, CNPq - Taxas de Bancada, CAPES - Taxas Acadêmicas e PROAP). Participação na elaboração de Projetos Institucionais para a Pós-Graduação do PADCT, no período.

Assessoria ao Chefe do Departamento de Química Fundamental, responsável pela distribuição didática das várias disciplinas oferecidas na área de Inorgânica. Membro desta Comissão por dois mandatos sucessivos.
 Participação na elaboração de Projetos Institucionais de Ensino de Graduação, aprovados pelo PADCT em 1986 e 1988.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SPRINT-FAPESP Biocompatible nanovectors based on hybrid lamellar materials and composites with polymers for drug release
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The present research proposal focus on the development of intercalated compounds based on biocompatible inorganic layered materials and polymer composite derivatives as carriers of bioactive species. The study will focus on synthetic cationic clays (beidellite) and layered double hydroxides (MgAl, ZnAl or MFeAl (M = Mg, Zn)) as inorganic hosts and various bioactive species such as commercial drugs, natural organic species and also metal complexes with potential properties for biomedical applications.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The present research proposal focus on the development of intercalated compounds based on biocompatible inorganic layered materials and polymer composite derivatives as carriers of bioactive species. The study will focus on synthetic cationic clays (beidellite) and layered double hydroxides (MgAl, ZnAl or MFeAl (M = Mg, Zn)) as inorganic hosts and various bioactive species such as commercial drugs, natural organic species and also metal complexes with potential properties for biomedical applications.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SPRINT-FAPESP Biocompatible nanovectors based on hybrid lamellar materials and composites with polymers for drug release

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Visita ao IQ-USP do Prof. Nicholas Farrell, da Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU, Richmond, VA, USA. O Dr. Farrell ministrará disciplina de PG, juntamente com a Profa. Ana Ferreira, "Metais de Transição em Sistemas Biológicos" e seminários. Também discutirá resultados de pesquisas em colaboração entre os dois grupos de pesquisa.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of transition metal complexes has proved to be of great value in the management of nutrients in agriculture. Complexes of the metals copper, manganese, zinc, cobalt and nickel were developed with the complexing agents aspartic acid and glutamic acid, and then dried in a spray dryer to obtain the compounds in solid form. Their characterization by solubility, pH, density, decomposition pH, compatibility with pesticides and corrosion were performed, obtaining satisfactory results for each of the determinations. The developed compounds have high stability under thermal stress when subjected to accelerated aging to determine shelf life. In addition, when performing foliar application of the compounds developed, the results were equally satisfactory with values higher than the control for each element.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development of transition metal complexes has proved to be of great value in the management of nutrients in agriculture. Complexes of the metals copper, manganese, zinc, cobalt and nickel were developed with the complexing agents aspartic acid and glutamic acid, and then dried in a spray dryer to obtain the compounds in solid form. Their characterization by solubility, pH, density, decomposition pH, compatibility with pesticides and corrosion were performed, obtaining satisfactory results for each of the determinations. The developed compounds have high stability under thermal stress when subjected to accelerated aging to determine shelf life. In addition, when performing foliar application of the compounds developed, the results were equally satisfactory with values higher than the control for each element.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Antioxidant and pro-oxidant properties of some di-Schiff base copper(II) complexes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The di-Schiff base complexes, [N,N0-bis(2-pyridyl)methylene-1,2-diaminoethane]- (N,N0,N00,N000)-copper(II) (1), and [N,N0-bis(2-
acetylpyrazyl)methylene-1,3-diaminopropane]-(N,N0,N00,N000)-copper(II) (2), were prepared in the perchlorate form, and characterized
using elemental analysis, UV/Vis, infrared (IR) and electronic paramagnetic resonance (EPR) spectroscopies. The relative
thermodynamic stabilities of these complexes were estimated by circular dichroism (CD), using bovine albumin as the competitive
ligand. Their antioxidant properties were verified by their catalytic activities in the dismutation of superoxide radicals (SOD activity),
and in the disproportionation of hydrogen peroxide (catalase activity). The determined SOD-activities were comparable to
that of known SOD mimics, with IC50 = 0.447 for (1) and 0.0902 lM for (2), in comparison to 0.0054 lM for the native Cu2Zn2-
SOD. The determined rate constants for the catalase activity were k= 0.098 mol¡1 dm3 s¡1, and 1.10 mol¡1 dm3 s¡1 to compounds
(1) and (2), respectively.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Roles of phosphate and an enoyl radical in ferritin iron mobilization by 5-aminolevulinic acid
Redox behaviour and reactivity of some di-Schiff base copper(II) complexes towards reduced oxygen species?

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of the Chemical Society, Dalton Transactions

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Some new di-Schiﬀ base copper(II) complexes, derived from 2,3-butanedione and 2-(2-aminophenyl)benzimidazole,
2-(aminomethyl)benzimidazole or 2-(2-aminoethyl)pyridine, have been prepared and characterised using UV/Vis, IR,
and EPR spectroscopy. Their reactivity towards superoxide radicals was studied, in comparison to similar complexes,
indicating that these species are usually good mimics of superoxide dismutase. Evidence of tetrahedral distortion
around the copper ion, similar to that observed in the native enzyme, was also found through spectroscopic
parameters. However, these new complexes can also generate hydroxyl radicals in appreciable quantities in the
presence of hydrogen peroxide, as detected by spin-trapping EPR experiments. By using µmol dm3 concentrations
of these complexes, considerable lipid peroxidation of liposomes prepared from -α-phosphatidylcholine was also
conﬁrmed, in vitro. Comparative studies with similar complexes pointed at a modulation of both antioxidant and
pro-oxidant properties by the diimine ligands. Their redox behaviour was studied by CV, with the aim of establishing
some correlation between estimated parameters, and observed reactivity versus reduced oxygen species (superoxide
radical and hydrogen peroxide). Among ﬁve compounds, only one was shown to be resistant to molecular oxygen,
after being reduced, in the range -1.50 to +0.50 V vs. NHE, in dimethylformamide solution containing tetraethylammonium
perchlorate (0.100 mol dm-3), although all exhibited substantial reactivity toward hydrogen peroxide.
In a wider range of potential, evidence of oxidation of the ligands was also detected. Tentative conclusions regarding
the most important parameters affecting their reactivity are made.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Equilibria and tyrosinase activity of a dinuclear and its analogous tetranuclear imidazolate-bridged copper(II) complexes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A copper(II) complex, [Cu(apip)(imH)]2+, containing an imidazole ligand, in addition to a discrete tridentate imine (apip=2-
[2-(2-pyridyl)ethylimino-1-ethyl]pyridine), was prepared. Both mono- and dinuclear species coexisted in aqueous solution
exhibiting a pH-dependent monomerdimer interconversion and were monitored by different techniques. Similar data were
obtained with the complex [SECu(imH)]+, where SE=2-salicylidene-aminoethane. Moreover, these species were isolated as
perchlorate salts and characterized by cyclic voltammetry and spectroscopic techniques (UV?Vis, IR, Raman, and EPR).
Experiments by capillary electrophoresis, in addition to parallel EPR spectra at different pH values, permitted to estimate the
equilibrium constant, corresponding to the equation: 2[LCu(imH)]2++OH− [LCu(im)CuL]3++H2O+imH, K=(83)×
107 mol−1 dm3, in reasonable agreement to the value determined by spectrophotometric measurements, K=(0.120.01)×107
mol−1 dm3. A further tetranuclear species, [Cu4(apip)4im4]4+, was obtained by a pH-dependent self-assembly process, separated
from very alkaline solutions of the corresponding mononuclear complex. The tetranuclear and dinuclear species were observed to
behave as good functional models of the tyrosinase enzyme, catalyzing the aerobic oxidation of 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol, in
methanolic solution, and that of 3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (L-dopa) in aqueous solution, with a biphasic behavior in the range
of pH 7?11. Applying the Michaelis?Menten approach, the kinetic parameters determined indicated that the tetranuclear species
is a better catalyst than the dinuclear ones, exhibiting a higher rate constant, k3, as well as a higher KM value. The hydrophobic
cavity in the polynuclear complex seems to facilitate its interaction with the phenol substrate, since the structural parameters
determined for both the complexes, di- and tetranuclear species were very similar.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
New copper(II) complexes with tridentate diimine ligands, containing imidazolate-bridging groups have been prepared as precursors of supramolecular-coordination-chemistry-based assemblies, designed to act as oxidation catalysts. These complexes were isolated as mono-, di- and polymeric or cyclic supramolecular species.
The catalytic activity of dinuclear and polymeric species in the oxidation of phenol substrates by molecular oxygen were verified, by monitoring the corresponding quinone formation.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Comparative kinetic studies on tyrosinase-like catalytic activity of dinuclear imidazole-containing copper(II) complexes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Chemical Catalysis. A, Chemical

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Comparative kinetic studies on the catalytic activity of some new dinuclear copper(II) complexes in the oxidation of
phenolic and catechol substrates are reported. These complexes, showing a tri- or tetradentate imine ligand containing
an imidazole group, or additionally an imidazolate- or phenolate bridge between the copper ions, were synthesized and
characterized by UV-Vis, IR, and EPR spectroscopy, and molar conductivity. Magnetic susceptibility measurements in the
solid state, in the temperature range 2¨C300 K, indicated an anti-ferromagnetic coupling of the copper(II) centers for all the
species studied. These compounds exhibited in aqueous solution an equilibrium between the dinuclear and the corresponding
mononuclear species, very dependent of the pH. Their catalytic activity in the oxidation of 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol, and of
3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (L-dopa) was monitored in methanol solution, following the corresponding quinone formation,
at 418 nm (¦Å = 5.48¡Á104 mol−1 l cm−1), or at 475 nm (¦Å = 3.60¡Á103 mol−1 l cm−1), respectively. Differing in some structural
features, their tyrosinase-like catalytic activity was verified to be influenced by several factors, including hydrophobic
character, and steric hindrance of the ligands, accessibility of the oxidant to the catalytic center, and mainly by the stability
of the dinuclear species in solution.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis, characterization and reactivity of trans-[RuCl(NO)(bpydip)]2+ {bpydip = N,N?-bis(7-methyl-2-pyridylmethylene)-1,3-diiminopropane}: a novel nitrosyl ruthenium complex displaying high electronic delocalization

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The adsorption of 2,2?:6?,2?-terpyridine, 4?-(5-mercaptopentyl)-2,2?:6?,2?-terpyridinyl, and perchlorate on silver and copper surfaces monitored by SERS

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The adsorption of 2,2':6',2''-terpyridine on Ag and Cu electrode surfaces has been studied by using surface enhanced Raman
spectroscopy (SERS). Two types of surface complexes have been found on a silver electrode: the first one is stable near the open
circuit potential, having bonding between tpy and silver active site analogous to the Ag-N bonding in the [AgI(tpy)Cl].2H2O
complex; and the second one is stable in the -0.1 to +0.5 V (Ag/AgCl) potential range, where the interaction between tpy and silver
active site is similar to the Cu-N bonding in the [CuII(tpy)Cl2] complex. The SERS spectra of 4'-(5-mercaptopentyl)-2,2':6',2'' terpyridinyl
(tpy-SH) have shown an increase in the relative intensity of the mercaptopentyl moiety bands and a band at 310 cm-1,
assigned to the AgS stretching, indicating an adsorption through the S atom. In addition, using the Raman results of different
copper perchlorate salts obtained with different hydration degrees, it has been possible to characterize the adsorption of perchlorate
anion on silver electrode and the kind of coordination in the [CuII(tpy)(H2O)(ClO4)]ClO4 and [CuII(tpy)(H2O)(ClO4)2] complexes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: New Copper(II) Complexes Containing 2-furoic hydrazide and 5-nitro-2-furoic Hydrazide Ligands: synthesis, thermal, magnetic and spectroscopic characterization.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Two new copper(II) complexes, [Cu2(L1)4(H2O)2](SO4)4 Æ 2H2O and [Cu(L2)2(H2O)2]SO4, were isolated containing
2-furoic hydrazide and 5-nitro-2-furoic hydrazide ligands, respectively. The complexes were characterized by
thermal, magnetic and spectroscopic techniques, showing a distorted tetragonal environment around the metal ion.
Compound (1), containing 2-furoic hydrazide as the ligand, appears to be dimeric in the solid state, with
substituted hydrazine acting as a bidentate bridging ligand. On the contrary, a monomeric species was observed
with the 5-nitro-2-furoic hydrazide ligand, probably in the cis conﬁguration, for compound (2). Magnetic
measurements for the binuclear copper(II) complex (1) were carried out at low temperatures, in the 2?300 K range,
and a magnetic ﬁeld of 500 G, indicating that besides an intramolecular ferromagnetic interaction between the two
Cu(II) centers, for which J/k ¼ 1.07 K, further weak antiferromagnetic interactions between adjacent dimers, with
J¢z/k ¼ )0.95 K, should be taken into account. However, in MeOH/H2O solution, evidence of equilibria involving
the dimer (1) and the corresponding mononuclear cis and trans species was obtained from e.p.r. spectra.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Molecular structure and intra- and intermolecular magnetic interactions in chloro-bridged copper(II) dimers

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Magnetic interactions in binuclear copper(II) complexes, [Cu2(apyhist)2Cl2](ClO4)2 (1) and [Cu2(2-pyhist)2Cl2](ClO4)2 (2) with
tridentate diimine ligands and chloro-bridged groups (where apyhist¼(4-imidazolyl)ethylene-2-amino-1-ethylpyridine and 2-pyhist
¼(4-imidazolyl)ethylene-2-aminomethylpyridine) were studied with the aim of better elucidating magneto-structural correlations
in such species, both in solution and in solid state. X-ray analyses revealed that chloro-bridged ligands keep the copper(II) ion
coordinated to adjacent unit, at Cu?Cl distances of 2.271 and 2.737 A, and a Cu?Cl?Cu angle of 87.46 in compound 1. Each CuII
atom is also coordinated to three N atoms from the imine ligand, in a distorted tetragonal pyramidal environment. Magnetic
measurements carried out in temperatures from 0.8 to 290 K and in magnetic ﬁeld up to 170 kOe indicated that besides the intramolecular
magnetic coupling between the copper centers [J=k ¼ ð1:93 0:05Þ K] further interactions between adjacent dimers
[J0z=k ¼ ð1:3 0:1Þ K] should be taken into account. Similar results were observed for compound 2, for which
[J=k ¼ ð4:27 0:05Þ K] and [J0z=k ¼ ð3:7 0:1Þ K]. In solution, the interconversion of the dimer 1 and the related monomer
species [Cu(apyhist)(H2O)2] (ClO4)2 (3) monitored by EPR spectra, was veriﬁed to be very dependent on the solvent.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Keto-enolic equilibria of an isatin-Schiff base copper(II) complex and its reactivity toward carbohydrate oxidation.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: FERREIRA, A. M. D.;FERREIRA, A;Ferreira, A.M.D.C.;Costa Ferreira, Ana Maria D.;Ferreira, Ana M. D. C.;Ferreira, Ana Maria da Costa;Ferreira, Ana M.Da Costa;Ferreira, Ana Maria da C.;DA COSTA FERREIRA, ANA M.;FERREIRA, ANA;FERREIRA, ANA MARIA C.;DA COSTA FERREIRA, ANA MARIA;FERREIRA, A. M. D. C.;Ferreira, Ana M.;FERREIRA, ANA M.C.;FERREIRA, ANA M. DA COSTA;Da Costa Ferreira, A.M.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An interesting isatin-Schiff base copper(II) complex, [Cu(isapn)](ClO4)2 where isapn = N,N¡¦-[bis-(3,3¡¦-indolin-2-one)]-1,3-diiminepropane, was prepared and characterized by different techniques, both in solid state and in solution, and its reactivity toward carbohydrate oxidation was verified. The positive ion electrospray mass spectrum detects the complex as an isotopomeric cluster of singly-charged intact isatin-copper(I) ions centered at m/z 395 (for 65Cu) with an isotopic pattern identical to that calculated for C19H16CuN4O2+. Tandem mass spectrometry reveals an interesting and structurally diagnostic collision-induced dissociation behavior for this ionized complex, which is dominated by the cleavage of the N-(CH2)3-N propylene bridge. In aqueous solution, this complex undergoes a peculiar keto-enolic equilibrium, verified at different pH by spectroscopic methods (UV/Vis and e.p.r.), with a corresponding pKa determined as 9.5. The e.p.r. parameter ratio g///A// for this complex, in frozen methanol/water (4:1, v/v) solution at 77 K, changes from 188 cm in acidic medium (pH 2.5 ¡V 3.0) to 118 cm in basic medium (pH 11), indicating a significant structural change from a distorted tetrahedral to a more tetragonal geometry around the copper ion. This compound was shown to catalyze the oxidation of hexoses (glucose, fructose and galactose), in alkaline media, via reactive oxygen species, which were detected by using specific enzymes, and by e.p.r. spin trapping. The reaction was monitored at (25.0 ?b 0.1)?aC by the consumption of oxygen, and showed first-order dependence on catalyst, followed by a saturation effect. A first-order kinetics on [OH-] concentration was also observed, indicating that enolization of the substrate as well as the metal-catalyzed enediol oxidation are rate-determining steps.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Kinetic studies of carbohydrate oxidation catalyzed by novel isatin Schiff base copper(II) complexes

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Chemical Catalysis. A, Chemical

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
With the aim of elucidating the mechanism of oxidative processes initiated by copper(II)¨Ccarbohydrate interactions, new isatin¨CSchiff
base copper(II) complexes, [Cu(isaen)H2O]ClO4¡¤2H2O (1), and [Cu(isaepy)2](ClO4)2¡¤2H2O (2), where isaen = N-[(3-indolin-2-one)]-1,3-
ethylenediamine and isaepy = N-[(3-indolin-2-one)]-2-aminoethyl pyridine were isolated, and characterized by elemental analyses, UV¨Cvis,
FTIR, EPR, and molar conductivity measurements. These imine ligands are capable of modifying selectively the environment of the copper(II)
ion in a pHcontrolled process, through keto¨Cenolic equilibria similar to those occurring with carbohydrates. Therefore, the obtained complexes
had their catalytic activity in the oxidation of common carbohydrates (glucose, fructose and galactose) by molecular oxygen, compared to that
of an analogous complex [Cu(isapn)](ClO4)2 (3), previously reported. The determined rate law, from kinetic curves of oxygen consumption,
showed a pseudo-first-order dependence both on the catalyst and substrate concentrations, followed by a saturation effect, for all the compounds
studied. Further, the pH profile indicated that reaction occurs significantly only in very alkaline medium (pH¡Ý10), and some influence of ionic
strength (controlled by carbonate buffer) was also verified. The participation of very reactive intermediates in the oxidative degradation of the
substrates was monitored by EPR spin trapping, while final products were identified by capillary electrophoresis. An extensive mechanism is
proposed, explaining new kinetic studies as well as earlier data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Equilibria and Catalytic Properties of a Chloro-bridged Diimine Copper(II) Complex in the N,N,N´,N´-tetramethyl-p-phenylenediamine (TMPD) Oxidation

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Some new copper(II) complexes with a tridentate imine ligand, bimpy (or 2-(benzimidazolyl)methylene-2-amino-1-ethylpyridine), were prepared, and had their catalytic activity in the N,N,N´,N´-tetramethyl-p-phenylenediamine (TMPD) oxidation compared. Mononuclear species, [Cu(bimpy)(H2O)2](NO3)2 1 and [Cu(bimpy)Cl2].H2O 2, as well as the dinuclear species containing chloro-bridges, [Cu2(bimpy)2Cl2]X2?nH2O as perchlorate 3, nitrate 4 and chloride 5 salts, respectively, were obtained and characterized by different techniques (UV/Vis, IR, EPR and X-rays crystallography). In non-aqueous solvents, the dinuclear species predominates; however, in aqueous solution or solvents containing water, equilibrium between dinuclear and correlated mononuclear species 1 was verified. Kinetic studies, in methanol solution, on the catalyzed TMPD oxidation indicated a first-order dependence of the initial rate with the catalyst concentration, and a saturation effect with increasing concentrations of the substrate. Dinuclear species was observed to be more reactive than the mononuclear one, and further experiments showed that the counter-ion chloride can significantly affect the kinetic parameters, mostly by shifting the mono-/dinuclear equilibrium, and stabilizing an ion-pair with the substrate.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Immobilization of ibuprofen and copper-ibuprofen drugs on layered double hydroxides
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Immobilization of ibuprofen and copper-ibuprofen drugs on layered double hydroxides

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this work we describe some studies about the interactions of the ibuprofen antiinflammatory drug and the copper(II)-ibuprofenato complex with an anionic layered double hydroxide (LDH). The [Cu2(ibp)4] complex and the ibuprofen drug were separately immobilized on [Mg3Al(OH)8](CO3)0.5. The isolated solid samples were characterized by elemental analysis, electronic (UV-visible) and vibrational Raman spectroscopies, X-ray diffraction (XRD), thermogravimetry (TGA) and electronic paramagnetic resonance (EPR). The characterization showed that the copper complex was supported on the external surfaces of the LDH. The ibuprofenato anion was supported on the external surfaces of the LDH or it was intercalated between the layers, depending on the synthetic route. The neutralizing and buffering capabilities of the modified LDH samples in aqueous HCl solutions were also evaluated.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this work we describe some studies about the interactions of the ibuprofen antiinflammatory drug and the copper(II)-ibuprofenato complex with an anionic layered double hydroxide (LDH). The [Cu2(ibp)4] complex and the ibuprofen drug were separately immobilized on [Mg3Al(OH)8](CO3)0.5. The isolated solid samples were characterized by elemental analysis, electronic (UV-visible) and vibrational Raman spectroscopies, X-ray diffraction (XRD), thermogravimetry (TGA) and electronic paramagnetic resonance (EPR). The characterization showed that the copper complex was supported on the external surfaces of the LDH. The ibuprofenato anion was supported on the external surfaces of the LDH or it was intercalated between the layers, depending on the synthetic route. The neutralizing and buffering capabilities of the modified LDH samples in aqueous HCl solutions were also evaluated.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Some copper(II) complexes with isatin (isa) or imine ligands derived from isatin were prepared, characterized by analytical and
spectroscopic techniques, and had their biological activity toward proliferation of two diﬀerent cell types veriﬁed. These complexes
exhibit keto-enolic equilibria in aqueous solution, very dependent of pH, although isolated in the solid state in one deﬁned form, and
this type of equilibrium was previously veriﬁed to be crucial for their catalytic activity in the oxidation of carbohydrates, through
intermediary generation of reactive oxygen species. Herein, biological studies carried out with tumor cells of diﬀerent origin such as
human neuroblastoma (SH-SY5Y) and promonocytic (U937) cells showed that these compounds exert diﬀerent toxicity. In particular,
while compounds [Cu(isaen)(H2O)]ClO4 Æ 2H2O 2, [Cu(isahist)(H2O)](ClO4)2 4 and [Cu(isa)2]ClO4 6 are not toxic for both cell
lines at the concentrations used in this study, compounds [Cu(isapn)](ClO4)2 1, [Cu(isaepy)2](ClO4)2 Æ 2H2O 3 and [Cu(isami)(H2O)]-
ClO4 5 are cytotoxic, with the compound 3 being the most eﬀective. In these compounds, isaen, isahist, isapn, isaepy and isami stand
for imine ligands prepared by condensation of ethylenediamine (en), histamine (hist), 1,3-diaminopropane (pn), 2-aminoethylpyridine
(epy), and 8-aminoquinoline (ami) with isatin (isa). Cells treated with these compounds were committed to the apoptotic program
as evidenced by cytoﬂuorimetric analyses of cell cycle. Moreover, the toxicity of compound 5 was equivalent for both cell lines
while the compound 1 was almost not toxic at 24 h for SH-SY5Y cells where only an arrest in G1 phase was observed. Compound 3
was more efficient in inducing cell death and also in this case a striking eﬀect on U937 cells (apoptotic cells 68% compared with 11%
of SH-SY5Y) was observed. Therefore, the results indicated that their activity seems to be ce

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Infinite zig-zag and cyclic-tetranuclear isomeric imidazolate-bridged polynuclear copper(II) complexes: Magnetic properties, catalytic activity and electrospray mass and tandem mass spectrometry characterization
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Infinite zig-zag and cyclic-tetranuclear isomeric imidazolate-bridged polynuclear copper(II) complexes: Magnetic properties, catalytic activity and electrospray mass and tandem mass spectrometry characterization

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-3.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Two mononuclear copper(II) complexes 1 and 2 with the unsymmetrical tridentate ligands 2- and 4-[((imidazol-2-ylmethylidene)amino)ethyl]pyridine have been prepared. In alkaline solution, deprotonation of the imidazole moiety in 1 and 2 promotes self-assembly, which yielded two structurally different species. Depending on the binding site in the imidazol ring, a polymeric complex with an infinite zig-zag-chain 3, or a cyclic-tetranuclear complex 4 are formed, as shown by spectroscopic and spectrometric analysis. Herein, structural characterization of these isomeric polynuclear complexes was performed by electrospray mass (ESI-MS) and tandem mass spectrometric experiments (ESI-MS/MS). Each isomer was shown to be stable in methanolic solutions and to display unique mass spectra with characteristic multiply charged molecular and fragment ions, corroborating previous data by EPR measurements. Magnetic data in the solid state fit a typical curve for an one-dimensional infinite regular chain system, with J = -(32.4 ?b 1.2) cm-1 and g = 2.03 for 3, and that of a cyclic-tetranuclear structure with J = -(55.5 +/- 0.4) cm-1 and g = 2.29 for 4. In the oxidation of 3,5-di-tert-butylcatechol (3,5-DTBC) by molecular oxygen, both complexes were shown to act as efficient catalysts, exhibiting very similar ratios: kcat/KM = 9.12x106 mol-1 dm3 min-1 for 3, and 8.73x106 mol-1 dm3 min-1 for 4. These similar ratios indicate that interactions between the metal centres in 3 or 4 and the substrate in solution occur predominantly at the outside of the catalyst framework.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Two mononuclear copper(II) complexes 1 and 2 with the unsymmetrical tridentate ligands 2- and 4-[((imidazol-2-ylmethylidene)amino)ethyl]pyridine have been prepared. In alkaline solution, deprotonation of the imidazole moiety in 1 and 2 promotes self-assembly, which yielded two structurally different species. Depending on the binding site in the imidazol ring, a polymeric complex with an infinite zig-zag-chain 3, or a cyclic-tetranuclear complex 4 are formed, as shown by spectroscopic and spectrometric analysis. Herein, structural characterization of these isomeric polynuclear complexes was performed by electrospray mass (ESI-MS) and tandem mass spectrometric experiments (ESI-MS/MS). Each isomer was shown to be stable in methanolic solutions and to display unique mass spectra with characteristic multiply charged molecular and fragment ions, corroborating previous data by EPR measurements. Magnetic data in the solid state fit a typical curve for an one-dimensional infinite regular chain system, with J = -(32.4 ?b 1.2) cm-1 and g = 2.03 for 3, and that of a cyclic-tetranuclear structure with J = -(55.5 +/- 0.4) cm-1 and g = 2.29 for 4. In the oxidation of 3,5-di-tert-butylcatechol (3,5-DTBC) by molecular oxygen, both complexes were shown to act as efficient catalysts, exhibiting very similar ratios: kcat/KM = 9.12x106 mol-1 dm3 min-1 for 3, and 8.73x106 mol-1 dm3 min-1 for 4. These similar ratios indicate that interactions between the metal centres in 3 or 4 and the substrate in solution occur predominantly at the outside of the catalyst framework.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Investigations of different carbohydrate anomers in copper(II) complexes with d-glucose, d-fructose, and d-galactose by Raman and EPR spectroscopy
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Investigations of different carbohydrate anomers in copper(II) complexes with d-glucose, d-fructose, and d-galactose by Raman and EPR spectroscopy

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: At the aim of verifying different carbohydrate anomers coordinated to copper(II) ions, some copper(II) complexes with D-glucose (Glc), D-fructose (Fru) and D-galactose (Gal), were prepared, and investigated by spectroscopic techniques. Their compositions were verified by elemental, ICP-AES and thermal analyses, in addition to conductivity measurements. The compounds isolated were consistent with the formula Na2[Cu2(carbohydrate)3]?ª8H2O and Na[Cu2(carbohydrate)3]?ª6H2O for the aldoses Glc and Gal, respectively, and Na2[Cu3(carbohydrate)4]?ª8H2O in the case of the ketose Fru. EPR spectra of these solids showed a rhombic environment around the metal center, and suggested the presence of different anomers of the carbohydrates in each case. By Raman spectroscopy it was possible to verify the predominance of the beta-anomer of D-glucose in the corresponding copper complex, while in the free ligand the alfa-anomer is preferential. In the case of the analogous complex with D-galactose, the spectrum of the complex shows bands of both anomers (alfa- and beta-) in approximately the same relative intensities as those observed in the isolated free ligand spectrum. On the other hand, for the complex with D-fructose a mixture of both furanose (five member ring) and pyranose (six member ring) structures was detected with prevalence of furanose structure. Based on variations in the relative intensities of characteristic Raman bands, the binding site for copper in fructose ligand was identified as most likely the C(1)H2OH and the anomeric C(2)OH, while in D-glucose it is presumably the anomeric C(1) OH and O (5) atom. These results indicated that EPR and Raman spectroscopy are suitable supporting techniques for the characterization of carbohydrate anomers coordinated to paramagnetic ions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis, structure and redox properties of an unexpected trinuclear copper(II) complex with aspartame: [Cu(apm)2Cu(?-N,O:O?-apm)2(H2O)Cu(apm)2(H2O)]·5H2O

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Herein, the first structurally resolved copper(II) complex with the ligand aspartame is described. X-ray crystallography data showed that the compound crystalizes as a surprisingly trinuclear species, in the triclinic P1, #1 space group, with the carboxylate groups of the ligands coordinated in two different ways. The two central ligands have carboxylate groups acting as bidentate bridges in a syn-anti conformation, while the four peripherical ligands have carboxylate groups in monodentate coordination to the metal, in a syn conformation. The beta-amino groups of all ligands complete the coordination sphere of the metal ion. Thermal analysis confirmed the determined structure. EPR spectra and CV curves indicated a rupture of the trinuclear framework when this complex was dissolved in ethanol or DMF, forming a mononuclear species, with a tetragonal structure.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Synthesis and crystal structure of 2,4-dihydro-4-[(5-hydroxy-3-methyl-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazol-4-yl)imino]-5-methyl-2-phenyl-3H-pyrazol-3-one and its copper(II) complex
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Synthesis and crystal structure of 2,4-dihydro-4-[(5-hydroxy-3-methyl-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazol-4-yl)imino]-5-methyl-2-phenyl-3H-pyrazol-3-one and its copper(II) complex

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Determinação de Estrutura de Compostos Inorgânicos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: 2-Diazo-3-methyl-1-phenyl-5-pyrazolone (2) and 2,4-dihydro-4-[(5-hydroxy-3-methyl-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazol-4-yl)imino]-5-methyl-2-phenyl-3H-pyrazol-3-one (3) were obtained in a one-pot reaction from 3-methyl-1-phenylpyrazol-5-one (1), mesyl azide, and K2CO3 in MeOH or CH2Cl2 solution. NMR, IR and ESI mass spectra as well as the crystal structure are reported for red colored 3. The crystal structure determined at 150K reveals that the corresponding bonds in the two phenylpyrazol-5-one moieties in each of the two independent ``U`` shaped molecules have essentially the same lengths, with an extensive delocalization in the central O-C-C-N-C-C-O fragment of the molecule. In particular, the hydrogen atom, formally a part of a hydroxyl group, is found near-midway [O1-HY and O11-HY = 1.24(4) and 1.19(4)Å, in molecule 1, and O21-HX and O31-HY = 1.203(4) and 1.19(4)Å, in molecule 2] between the two oxygen atoms (formally in a carbonyl and a hydroxy group), with near linear O-H-O bond angles of 173.8(4) and 172.7(4)o in the two independent molecules. All C-O bond lengths are in the narrow range of 1.271(3) - 1.288(3) Å. Further, since this compound shows different coordinating groups, its binding ability towards copper(II) ions was investigated. A dark red complex 4, obtained by reaction of 3 with copper(II) ions at stoichiometric ratio, was characterized as a neutral 1:1 species, [3:CuCl2], involving tautomeric forms, by ESI-MS, ESI-MS/MS, IR, UV/Vis and EPR spectra. Interestingly, copper coordination to ligand 3 occurs solely by oxygen atoms, in spite of the presence of nitrogen donor centers. The deprotonation of 4 was monitored by UV/Vis, and a corresponding pKa value was determined as (5.6 +/- 0.2).
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: 2-Diazo-3-methyl-1-phenyl-5-pyrazolone (2) and 2,4-dihydro-4-[(5-hydroxy-3-methyl-1-phenyl-1H-pyrazol-4-yl)imino]-5-methyl-2-phenyl-3H-pyrazol-3-one (3) were obtained in a one-pot reaction from 3-methyl-1-phenylpyrazol-5-one (1), mesyl azide, and K2CO3 in MeOH or CH2Cl2 solution. NMR, IR and ESI mass spectra as well as the crystal structure are reported for red colored 3. The crystal structure determined at 150K reveals that the corresponding bonds in the two phenylpyrazol-5-one moieties in each of the two independent ``U`` shaped molecules have essentially the same lengths, with an extensive delocalization in the central O-C-C-N-C-C-O fragment of the molecule. In particular, the hydrogen atom, formally a part of a hydroxyl group, is found near-midway [O1-HY and O11-HY = 1.24(4) and 1.19(4)Å, in molecule 1, and O21-HX and O31-HY = 1.203(4) and 1.19(4)Å, in molecule 2] between the two oxygen atoms (formally in a carbonyl and a hydroxy group), with near linear O-H-O bond angles of 173.8(4) and 172.7(4)o in the two independent molecules. All C-O bond lengths are in the narrow range of 1.271(3) - 1.288(3) Å. Further, since this compound shows different coordinating groups, its binding ability towards copper(II) ions was investigated. A dark red complex 4, obtained by reaction of 3 with copper(II) ions at stoichiometric ratio, was characterized as a neutral 1:1 species, [3:CuCl2], involving tautomeric forms, by ESI-MS, ESI-MS/MS, IR, UV/Vis and EPR spectra. Interestingly, copper coordination to ligand 3 occurs solely by oxygen atoms, in spite of the presence of nitrogen donor centers. The deprotonation of 4 was monitored by UV/Vis, and a corresponding pKa value was determined as (5.6 +/- 0.2).

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Di-imine copper(II) complexes as redox mediator and modulator in 2-deoxy-D-ribose oxidative damage
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Di-imine copper(II) complexes as redox mediator and modulator in 2-deoxy-D-ribose oxidative damage

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Redox properties of copper complexes are important for their catalytic functions in vitro and in biological systems, and can contribute to their reactivity toward selected targets. In order to evaluate the influence of different ligands on the reactivity of copper ions, comparative studies were carried out with some copper(II) complexes containing a tridentate imine, or a tetradentate di-Schiff base ligand with a mixed pyridine, pyrazine, or imidazole donor set, acting as catalysts in the oxidation of 2-deoxy-D-ribose (DR). Addition of the reducing agent glutathione (-glutamylcysteinylglycine; GSH), which can also act as good ligand to copper(I), mediated the oxidation of the substrate. For some of these compounds, a reductive activation followed by competition for the metal ion was verified, with formation of copper(I)-glutathione complex monitored by fluorescence measurements. For others, however, the reduction of the metal by the glutathione seems to not occur. In the presence of hydrogen peroxide, the oxidative damage is significantly enhanced for all the complexes tested. Redox potential measurements by cyclic voltammetry (CV) corroborated partially these results, indicating that the most reactive complexes are those with more positive redox potential. Evidence for site-specific attack to DR was also observed, consistent with the intermediary formation of a copper-hydroxyl species, [LCuII(?OH)], rather than ?free? hydroxyl radical.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Redox properties of copper complexes are important for their catalytic functions in vitro and in biological systems, and can contribute to their reactivity toward selected targets. In order to evaluate the influence of different ligands on the reactivity of copper ions, comparative studies were carried out with some copper(II) complexes containing a tridentate imine, or a tetradentate di-Schiff base ligand with a mixed pyridine, pyrazine, or imidazole donor set, acting as catalysts in the oxidation of 2-deoxy-D-ribose (DR). Addition of the reducing agent glutathione (-glutamylcysteinylglycine; GSH), which can also act as good ligand to copper(I), mediated the oxidation of the substrate. For some of these compounds, a reductive activation followed by competition for the metal ion was verified, with formation of copper(I)-glutathione complex monitored by fluorescence measurements. For others, however, the reduction of the metal by the glutathione seems to not occur. In the presence of hydrogen peroxide, the oxidative damage is significantly enhanced for all the complexes tested. Redox potential measurements by cyclic voltammetry (CV) corroborated partially these results, indicating that the most reactive complexes are those with more positive redox potential. Evidence for site-specific attack to DR was also observed, consistent with the intermediary formation of a copper-hydroxyl species, [LCuII(?OH)], rather than ?free? hydroxyl radical.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Spectroscopic characterization of polyaniline doped with transition metal salts
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Spectroscopic characterization of polyaniline doped with transition metal salts

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
For the first time resonance Raman, X-ray absorption near edge (XANES) of Fe, Cu and
N and electronic paramagnetic resonance (EPR) techniques were employed to characterize the complexes formed by the interaction of Fe(III), Cu(II) and Zn(II) with polyaniline (PANI), in emeraldine base form (EB-PANI). The formation of semiquinone segments (radical cation) upon coordination of Cu(II) and Fe(III) to EB-PANI were undoubtedly demonstrated by resonance Raman spectroscopy. The characteristic doublet band at ca. 1330 cm-1 attributed to C-N+? and the band at 1618 cm-1 assigned to C=C are observed. Through Cu and Fe XANES spectra, no change in the metal ions oxidation state after PANI doping is observed. The EPR spectra of Cu-PANI and Fe-PANI are dominated by metal cation signal showing a broad signal for Cu(II) at giso = 2.138 and a typical low spin signal of Fe(III) at g = 4.421 and 1.903. The presence of radical cations segments is confirmed in Zn-PANI complex both through the very sharp EPR signal at 2.004, and the characteristic radical cation resonance Raman spectrum. In addition, thermogravimetric data of Cu-PANI and Fe-PANI show a remarkable decrease in the polymer stability both in air and in nitrogen atmosphere.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
